items.title: Spot Prices Wrap: Midwest Strength Fails to Offset Broad Spot Gas Weakness
items.summary: Price action varied at hubs nationwide Thursday. While the overall bias was lower, some gains and losses went against shifting forecasts, which pointed to softer demand in the East and Central U.S. and stronger demand in the West.

items.title: Futures Settle: Natural Gas Pops, Then Drops After Storage Data
items.summary: Anticipation of a larger storage withdrawal for the week ended Feb. 6 sparked an early rally in natural gas futures Thursday, but gains faded once the data hit traders’ screens.

items.title: TotalEnergies Expects Mexico’s Energía Costa Azul LNG Terminal to Enter Service This Year
items.summary: TotalEnergies SE expects new LNG export projects coming online this year in Mexico and Qatar that it holds interests in to offset a fall in global natural gas prices as more supplies hit the market.

items.title: MidDay Snapshot: Natural Gas Cash Prices Diverge by Region
items.summary: Natural gas prices in the daily spot market varied by region on Thursday but dipped lower overall amid softening weather-driven demand across a majority of the Lower 48.

items.title: Natural Gas Forwards Soften Again, But Basis Strength Signals Risk of Regional Volatility
items.summary: U.S. natural gas forward prices dipped again over the past week as markets continued to recover from January’s bitter cold, but modest strengthening in basis prices indicate traders haven’t ruled out risks of regional volatility.

items.title: Winter’s Worst Widens East Region Natural Gas Storage Deficit
items.summary: Stockpiles of natural gas in the East region fell farther below the five-year average during the first week of February, raising supply questions and helping to explain recent spikes in regional prices.

items.title: Haynesville Natural Gas Takeaway Capacity Fills Gap as Permian Egress Lags Behind
items.summary: Southbound natural gas flows out of the Haynesville Shale topped 5 Bcf/d in late 2025 after two new pipelines entered service, boosting Gulf Coast supply while Permian Basin takeaway additions remain months away.

items.title: MidDay Futures: Natural Gas Prices Level Off in Wake of Steep Storage Print
items.summary: Natural gas futures advanced through midday on Thursday, though a government inventory result that fell shy of predictions tempered sentiment a touch.

items.title: Midmorning Markets: Stout Natural Gas Storage Withdrawal Falls Short of Forecasts Again
items.summary: The U.S. Energy Information Administration (EIA) on Thursday reported a 249 Bcf net withdrawal of natural gas from storage for the week ended Feb. 6, marking a second straight week of heavier than normal declines as fierce cold lingered over large po

items.title: Delfin LNG Potentially Facing Delays as Regulatory Hurdles Mount, Lawsuit Filed After Pipeline Failure
items.summary: Developers of the Delfin LNG export project in Louisiana will have to navigate additional regulatory scrutiny and possible delays as federal orders and lawsuits crop up following a pipeline explosion.

items.title: Why the AI Boom May Extend the Reign of Natural Gas
items.summary: Artificial intelligence is often viewed as a catalyst for electrification and subsequently decarbonization. Yet one of its most immediate effects may be the opposite of what many assume. The rapid buildout of AI infrastructure is increasing demand fo

items.title: Oil Prices Drop 3% After IEA Cuts Demand Growth Outlook
items.summary: Oil prices dropped Thursday after the International Energy Agency cut its demand growth outlook, a revision that landed in a market already uneasy about how quickly supply is said to be rising. Brent crude traded near $67 a barrel in the afternoon, d

items.title: Trump Disavows Oil Executive’s Role in Venezuela Talks
items.summary: President Donald Trump on Thursday rejected any suggestion that a private U.S. oil executive is shaping Washington’s approach to Venezuela, stepping into a sensitive debate over who gets influence in the future of the world’s largest stranded crude r

items.title: Top Trader Sees Sanctions Tightening Market and Lifting Oil Prices
items.summary: The sanctions squeeze on oil supply from Russia and Iran are tightening the oil market and supporting crude prices as buyers look for additional legit barrels while sanctioned supply is piling in floating storage, according to the world’s biggest ind

items.title: OPEC+ Oil Production Falls by 439,9000 Bpd
items.summary: Crude oil production from the OPEC+ alliance slumped by as much as 439,000 barrels per day in January compared to December as a major supply disruption in Kazakhstan added to lower output from Iran and Venezuela, OPEC data showed in its Monthly Oil M
